Detailed Description

EventLauncher class receives sensor data from "Particles" and posts it onto the "Event Heap".

The two main functionalities of this class are:

  1. Receive packets with sensor data from "Particles".
  2. Post the sensor data packet onto the "Event Heap" only if its different from the last packet.

String  eventHeapIp,
String  proxyID
) 
 

EventLauncher class constructor.

The constructor initializes the local variables with the parameters provided.

Parameters:
configuredParticles as a Vector. This vector contains ID of all the "Particles" that have been configured to receive sensor data.
eventHeapIp as a String. Specifies the IP address of the "Event Heap".
proxyID as a String. Specifies the proxy ID to be used while posting Events and to be checked while receiving events.

Member Function Documentation

void EventLauncher.run (   ) 
 

Receives sensor data from the "Particles" and posts them as events onto the "Event Heap".

This method receives the sensor data packets from the "Particles" that are contained in the "particles" vector. On reception of each packet, it is checked for changes from the last packet received by the same "Particle". If the packet is different, it is posted as Event onto the "Event Heap".
